alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Bath; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 07 at 3:38AM EST until March 07 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON to 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM TO 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, southwest winds 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. For the second Wind Advisory, west winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For the High Wind Watch, southwest to west winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph possible, especially during a period of expected moderate to heavy rain showers. * WHERE...In Virginia, Tazewell, Bath and Amherst Counties. In West Virginia, Mercer, Summers and Western Greenbrier Counties. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 2 PM EST this afternoon. For the second Wind Advisory, from 7 PM to 9 PM EST this evening. For the High Wind Watch, from 2 PM EST this afternoon through to 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Scattered power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Be especially cautious across higher terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds today and this evening are expected to accompany a narrow line of moderate to heavy rain showers that will traverse the region from west to east between mid-afternoon west of the Blue Ridge to early evening east of the Blue Ridge.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle particularly across higher terrain. Secure outdoor objects. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
